sen.j: 本願寺は依然として雑賀衆などの支援を集めつつ強勢を保ったが、次第に敵中に孤立していき、1580年、ついに正親町天皇の勅命を引き出した信長に屈して石山本願寺を退去し、領主権力としての本願寺は消滅した。
sen.e: Hongan-ji Temple still kept predominance by gaining support from Saikashu, but was gradually isolated in the midst of enemies, and at last succumbed to Nobunaga who withdrew imperial command from Ogimachi Emperor and left Ishiyama Honganji Temple in 1580, whereby Hongan-ji Temple as signiory extinguished.

Hongan-ji Temple retained its predominance by gaining support from Saikashu, but gradually it was isolated in the midst of enemies, ultimately succumbing to Nobunaga, who withdrew imperial command from Emperor Ogimachi and left Ishiyama Honganji Temple in 1580, whereby Hongan-ji Temple as seigniory was extinguished.

sen.j: このとき顕如の意向に反して抵抗を続けることを主張した長子教如と顕如は仲違いし、1593年に顕如が示寂すると、三男の准如が後継者に立てられた。
sen.e: At that time, Kyonyo, who was the eldest child of Kennyo and insisted on continuing the resistance in spite of the intention of Kennyo had a falling out with Kennyo, and when Kennyo died, the third son Junnyo was welcomed as successor.

sen.j: これより門主の座をめぐって本願寺は分裂の道を歩み始め、1602年に徳川家康が教如に准如の本願寺教団と別の寺地を与えて東本願寺を分立させた。
sen.e: This incident was the starting point of the path of schism over the position of Monshu, chief priest, for Hongan-ji Temple, and in 1602 Ieyasu TOKUGAWA schismatized Hongan-ji Temple by giving Kyonyo temple and land for Higashi Hongan-ji Temple, which was separated from Junnyo's Honganji Buddhist Sect.

sen.j: このとき、西本願寺となった准如の教団から東本願寺の教如のもとに移る門徒が多くあらわれ､本願寺は東西に分裂した。
sen.e: At this point, lots of followers moved from Junnyo's bhuddhist sect, which became Nishi Honganji Temple toKyonyo's Higashi Hongan-ji Temple, whereby Hongan-ji Temple was schismatized into east and west.

At this point numerous followers moved from Junnyo's Buddhist sect, which became Nishi (West) Honganji Temple, to Kyonyo's Higashi Hongan-ji Temple, whereby Hongan-ji Temple was split into eastern and western factions.

sen.j: もともと公家の日野有範の子息である親鸞と、日野広綱（覚如の父）の血統を引く東西両大谷家当主は、代々有力公家の猶子になる慣習があり、また、代々公家と通婚を続けており母系によっても公家化が進んでいった。
sen.e: There was a custom over generations that both of the east and west Otani Family's family heads who have lineage from Shinran who was a son of court noble Arinori HINO, and Hirotsuna HINO (Kakunyo's father) were adopted by influential court noble, and both Otani Families have been related to court nobles more and more considering the maternal line since they kept marriges with court nobles over generations.

There was a custom developed over generations that both the eastern and western family heads of the Otani Family's having lineage from Shinran, who was a son of the court noble Arinori HINO, and Hirotsuna HINO (Kakunyo's father) were adopted by influential court nobles; consequently, both the Otani families have increasingly been related to court nobles considering the maternal line, since they kept marriages with court nobles over generations.

sen.j: このような経緯から明治維新後、両大谷家は華族に列し、ともに伯爵を授けられた。
sen.e: In view of the above-mentioed facts, both Otani Families were listed as new nobility and entitled as earl after Meiji Restoration.
In view of the above-mentioned facts, both of the Otani families were listed as new nobility and entitled to their status as earls after the Meiji Restoration.

In view of the above-mentioned facts, both of the Otani families were listed as new members of the nobility and entitled to hold the position of Hakushaku (roughly equivalent to a count or countess in English) after the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: "nobility" is not a countable noun. Also, I don't think "earl" or "count" really works as a translation of "伯爵" so I have changed this to romaji and provided an explanation in parentheses.
